initial_intent: Create a 6-month phased migration plan from monolithic architecture to microservices for an e-commerce platform with zero downtime.
context: Current: Monolithic Java app, MySQL database, 10M users, peak 5K TPS. Team: 15 developers, 3 DevOps. Must maintain: Payment processing, inventory, user accounts during transition.
steps: Conduct audit of monolith and map service dependencies/domain boundaries.
Define microservices architecture: choose framework, API gateway, service mesh, and communication protocols.
Establish infrastructure foundation: set up Kubernetes cluster, CI/CD pipeline, and monitoring.
Implement Strangler Fig pattern with routing facade in front of monolith.
Extract first low-risk service (Product Catalog) and deploy alongside monolith.
Route incremental traffic (1-100%) to new service while monitoring metrics.
Migrate User Account service with dual-write strategy and incremental traffic cutover.
Migrate Inventory Management service using event sourcing and shadow mode deployment.
Design and test Payment Service migration with extreme caution and multiple rollback points.
Implement circuit breakers and route minimal real payment traffic initially.
Establish data synchronization and reconciliation processes between old and new systems.
Stop dual-writes and make each microservice database the source of truth.
Decommission migrated modules from monolith progressively.
Optimize microservices performance: caching, auto-scaling, and communication patterns.
Conduct end-to-end load testing simulating peak traffic.
Perform disaster recovery drill and security penetration testing.
Get stakeholder sign-off from security, compliance, and business teams.
Decommission monolith routing facade and shut down old application.
Archive monolithic codebase and complete project documentation.
Establish new operating model and conduct retrospective with lessons learned.

initial_intent: Design a comprehensive 3-month product launch campaign targeting Gen Z for a new sustainable fashion brand.
context: Product: Eco-friendly activewear line. Budget: $250K. Channels available: TikTok, Instagram, influencer partnerships, pop-up events. Competitors: Lululemon, Gymshark. Launch date: September 1.
steps: Define brand UVP and create Gen Z buyer personas.
Set SMART goals and allocate budget across channels and phases.
Pre-launch: Build mystery with cryptic teasers and email collection.
Develop visual identity and secure campaign hashtag.
Partner with nano-influencers for early buzz and UGC.
Launch hero video about sustainable sourcing and product details.
Execute multi-tier influencer strategy (macro, micro, nano).
Launch TikTok dance challenge with branded sound and prizes.
Host Instagram Live series with founders and sustainability experts.
Execute pop-up event in key city for immersive experience.
Run paid social ads with A/B testing on creatives and copy.
Implement flash sale or limited-edition drop for urgency.
Launch day blitz: peak paid media, influencer posts, and final emails.
Retargeting campaigns for website visitors and abandoned carts.
Aggressively leverage social proof and share UGC/press mentions.
Post-purchase engagement: thank-you emails and community invites.
Analyze campaign performance: ROI, CAC, engagement metrics.
Identify top-performing content and influencers for future.
Plan loyalty program announcement for early adopters.
Compile final campaign report and plan next collection tease.

initial_intent: Outline a 12-month academic research proposal on the ethical implications of generative AI in education, with quarterly milestones.
context: Field: Computer Science + Education. Team: 1 PI, 2 PhD students, 1 postdoc. Methods: Literature review, case studies, surveys, interviews. Deliverables: Conference papers, dataset, framework.
steps: Refine research question and define key terms.
Conduct systematic literature review following PRISMA guidelines.
Develop theoretical framework and research methodology.
Submit proposal to IRB/ethics committee.
Design mixed-methods instruments: surveys and interview protocols.
Select case study institutions and secure access.
Deploy national survey to educators and students.
Conduct in-depth interviews with stakeholders at case sites.
Transcribe and code qualitative data using NVivo.
Analyze quantitative survey data with statistical tests.
Triangulate qualitative and quantitative findings.
Develop GAiEE (Generative AI in Education Ethics) Framework.
Write and submit conference papers to top-tier venues.
Create public-facing website with framework and findings.
Produce policy brief for educational administrators.
Organize symposium to present findings to educators.
Record podcast episode summarizing research.
Archive anonymized data in public repository.
Write final project report for funding body.
Plan next research phase based on findings.

initial_intent: Create a personalized 90-day skill acquisition plan for transitioning from software engineer to machine learning engineer.
context: Current skills: Python, web development, basic statistics. Target: ML engineering role at tech company. Available: 15 hours/week. Resources: Coursera, fast.ai, Kaggle, open-source projects.
steps: Self-assess current skills and research target MLE role requirements.
Brush up on linear algebra, calculus, and statistics fundamentals.
Master Python data science stack: NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib/Seaborn.
Complete core ML course (Coursera ML by Andrew Ng).
Implement key algorithms from scratch and using scikit-learn.
Complete fast.ai practical deep learning course.
Build and train CNN image classifier on custom dataset.
Learn ML engineering lifecycle and hyperparameter tuning.
Containerize model with Docker and build REST API with FastAPI.
Choose specialization track (CV or NLP) and complete focused course.
Complete end-to-end Kaggle project with full documentation.
Deploy model as web app using Streamlit or Flask.
Study ML system design and distributed training basics.
Contribute to open-source ML library or fix documentation.
Practice ML interview questions and LeetCode problems.
Create portfolio website showcasing projects and blog posts.
Update LinkedIn and connect with ML engineers for networking.
Conduct mock interviews focusing on technical and behavioral questions.
Tailor resume for MLE roles and begin applying.
Establish continuous learning plan with research paper reading.
